title: 108_hr466
content:
Section 1 of the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990 is amended to adjust differentials in paragraph (1) of section 404(b). The differential percentages for various Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Areas are as follows:
- Atlanta: 16.82%
- Boston-Worcester-Lawrence: 24.42%
- Chicago-Gary-Kenosha: 25.68%
- Cincinnati-Hamilton: 21.47%
- Cleveland: 17.83%
- Columbus: 16.90%
- Dallas: 18.51%
- Dayton: 15.97%
- Denver-Boulder-Greeley: 22.78%
- Detroit-Ann Arbor-Flint: 25.61% In the Detroit-Ann Arbor-Flint, MI Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Area, the percentage is 25.61%. Other areas include Hartford, CT at 24.47%, Houston-Galveston-Brazoria, TX at 30.39%, Los Angeles-Riverside-Orange County, CA at 27.25%, and Miami-Fort Lauderdale, FL at 21.75%. The Minneapolis-St. Paul, MN-WI Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Area has a percentage of 20.27%. New York-Northern New Jersey-Long Island, NY-NJ-CT-PA Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Area is at 27.17%. Orlando, FL has 14.22%, Philadelphia-Wilmington-Atlantic City, PA-NJ-DE-MD has 21.03%, Pittsburgh has 14.89%, Portland-Salem, OR-WA has 20.96%, Richmond has 16.46%, Sacramento-Yolo, CA has 20.77%, and San Diego, CA has 22.13%. The San Diego, CA Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Area has a percentage of 22.13%. San Francisco-Oakland-San Jose, CA has 32.98%, Seattle-Tacoma-Bremerton, WA has 21.18%, St. Louis has 14.69%, and Washington-Baltimore, DC-MD-VA-WV has 19.48%. The rest of the United States has 14.19%. Special rules apply to certain counties in RI, ME, and NH, treating them as part of the Boston-Worcester-Lawrence, MA-NH-ME-CT-RI area. The amendment designates Capitol Police as law enforcement officers under the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990. It will be effective retroactively to the enactment of the Act and only apply to pay for service after the enactment date. Subsection (b) will be applied consistently with this provision. SEC. 2. LIMITATION ON PREMIUM PAY. Amends Section 5547 of title 5, United States Code by removing references to section 5545a. Effective date is retroactive to the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002.
